definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: And as they cried out and threw off their garments, and cast dust into the air.
sentences.chinese: 他們遂喧譁吶喊，扔下衣服，並向空中揚土。

sentences.chinese: 我扔下掃帚，恨恨地大喊起來。

sentences.english: All the seeds she had dropped had grown into trees.

sentences.english: Dashing down the rifle, he drew out a dagger and streaked towards the enemy soldier.

sentences.english: But is she very ill?' I asked, flinging down my rake and tying my bonnet.
sentences.chinese: “她的病很嚴重嗎？”我問道，扔下耙子，繫上帽子。

sentences.english: Kearney cursed and threw down his radio.
sentences.chinese: 科尼爾咒罵着扔下無線收音機。

sentences.english: So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, breaking them to pieces before your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我就把那兩塊版從我手中扔下去，在你們眼前摔碎了。

sentences.english: Picks again your that rose, throws gently down.
sentences.chinese: 再把你那玫瑰摘一朵，輕輕地扔下來。
那上帝又把它扔下來了嗎？

sentences.english: If you threw your pack from the chopper, what's that?

sentences.english: Dropped this sentence, he went straight away.
sentences.chinese: 扔下這句話後，他頭也不回地走了。

sentences.english: Instead, throw off the unrighteous behavior.
sentences.chinese: 而要去扔下那非正義的行爲。

sentences.english: Zhou Lijun laughed, dropped the drinks and the card away.
sentences.chinese: 周立軍笑了，扔下了酒錢和那張名片就走了。

definition: to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to rush out through a door (idiom)
to run away/to take to one's heels
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
to swagger off/to walk off (or drive off etc) without a second thought for those left behind
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to take to one's heels/to scram
